metadata.title: CVE-2022-21716 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Twisted is an event-based framework for internet applications, supportingPython 3.6+. Prior to 22.2.0, Twisted SSH client and server implement isable to accept an infinite amount of data for the peer's SSH versionidentifier. This ends up with a buffer using all the available memory. Theattach is a simple as `nc -rv localhost 22 < /dev/zero`. A patch isavailable in version 22.2.0. There are currently no known workarounds.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-21716` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-twisted - 17.9.0-2ubuntu0.3
python-twisted-bin - 17.9.0-2ubuntu0.3
python-twisted-core - 17.9.0-2ubuntu0.3
python-twisted-mail - 17.9.0-2ubuntu0.3
python-twisted-names - 17.9.0-2ubuntu0.3
python-twisted-news - 17.9.0-2ubuntu0.3
python-twisted-runner - 17.9.0-2ubuntu0.3
python-twisted-web - 17.9.0-2ubuntu0.3
python-twisted-words - 17.9.0-2ubuntu0.3
python3-twisted - 17.9.0-2ubuntu0.3
python3-twisted-bin - 17.9.0-2ubuntu0.3
python-twisted-conch - 1:17.9.0-2ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: twisted package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '17.9.0-2ubuntu0.3').
twisted package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '17.9.0-2ubuntu0.3').
